## Abar Byomkesh 2012 720p HD Bengali Movie 18

  
Byomkesh Bakshi is a film series based on the fictional detective Byomkesh Bakshi, who is a famous character in Bengali literature. The films are directed by Anjan Dutt, a renowned filmmaker and musician, and produced by Kaustuv Ray, a prominent businessman and film producer. The first film in the series was released on 13 August 2010 and received positive reviews from critics and audiences. The series has continued to produce five more sequels till date, each one featuring a different mystery and adventure for Byomkesh Bakshi and his assistant Ajit. The sequels are Abar Byomkesh (2012), Byomkesh Phire Elo (2012), Byomkesh Bakshi (2015), Byomkesh O Chiriyakhana (2016) and Byomkesh O Agnibaan (2017).

The film series is based on the stories written by Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay, a prolific writer of Bengali literature. He created the character of Byomkesh Bakshi in 1932 and wrote 32 stories featuring him till 1970. Byomkesh Bakshi is considered to be one of the most popular and influential detectives in Indian literature and culture. He is often compared to Sherlock Holmes, Hercule Poirot and Feluda.
  
The films are set in the 1940s and 1950s, during the British Raj and the post-independence era. They depict the social and political scenario of Bengal at that time, as well as the crime and corruption that plagued the society. Byomkesh Bakshi is portrayed as a sharp and intelligent investigator, who uses his logic and intuition to solve complex cases. He is assisted by Ajit Bandyopadhyay, his friend and chronicler, who also narrates the stories. Byomkesh Bakshi also has a love interest, Satyabati, whom he marries in the later stories.
  
The films have been praised for their faithful adaptation of the original stories, as well as their cinematography, music, costumes and performances. The films have also been successful at the box office, making them one of the most popular film franchises in Bengali cinema. The films have also won several awards and accolades, such as the National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Bengali for Byomkesh Bakshi (2015) and the Filmfare Award for Best Director (Bengali) for Anjan Dutt for Byomkesh O Chiriyakhana (2016).
